conclusion: Object A is at a height h = 1 m above the ground.
Object B is on an inclined plane with an angle θ = 37°.
Both objects have a mass m = 1 kg.

premise: The gravitational force on A is mg.
conclusion: The gravitational force on B along the incline is mg sin θ.

premise: When the system is released, A moves downward and B moves up the incline.
conclusion: The acceleration of the system can be found using Newton's second law: a = g(1 - sin θ).

premise: The time t for A to fall 1 m is given by h = (1/2) a t².
The velocity v of B at this moment is v = at.
After the string breaks, B moves up the incline with initial velocity v = 2√2 m/s and deceleration g sin θ = 6 m/s².
conclusion: The time t₁ to reach the maximum height is v = g sin θ × t₁.

premise: The height h₁ reached by B is h₁ = v t₁ - (1/2) g sin θ t₁².
The time t₂ to return to the bottom is h₁ = (1/2) g sin θ t₂².
The total time t_total is t₁ + t₂.
